documents.name: Adonna
documents.domains: Goddess of Beauty and Art
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Molton and Nera

documents.name: Agrios
documents.domains: God of the Feywind, Wild places, and freedom
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Sylvan and Gaian

documents.name: Alidal
documents.domains: Goddess of the Hunt
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Mat'raktha and Gaian

documents.name: Alitheia
documents.domains: Goddess of Truth, Sight, and Divination
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Fanome and Nera

documents.name: Alohim
documents.holysymbol: A Yellow Rising Sun on a White Background
documents.domains: Light, Rulership, the Divine Right of Kings
documents.worshippers:
Alohim is worshiped mostly by nobles, particularly those who believe in a divine right to rule, and the nobility of strength.

The Clergy of Alohim tend to be wealthy, as they receive large donations from the nobility whom they support. They tend to support good order in a country through the strict separation of nobility and serf.
documents.appearance: Alohim has shoulder length golden brown hair, often tied back and golden brown eyes.  He either dresses in rich noble clothing with plenty of gold trim and purple or golden armor and well-made boots of leather.  He has a long face with large features.
tenets: I must above all, safeguard the lives of those who depend on me.
I must recognize the divine right to command granted to Kings and their vassals.
I must pray each day at dawn, celebrating the coming of the light.
I must never show cowardice in the face of my enemies
I must keep myself pure both in appearance and soul
documents.holiday: Alohiman 26, The Dominion of the Sun. On the longest day of the year people celebrate with dancing in public squares and other outdoor spaces. Great tables are set up and it is encumbant on the local lord to host a great breakfast feast for the whole town at dawn. It is also the traditional day for oaths of fealty.
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, Born of Nera
documents.lore: Alohim, the eldest child of Nera, is considered among good aligned nations to be the father of the Gods, which makes sense given that his 3 daughters are 3 of the most revered in such places, Amathera, Sara, and Cora. He and his daughters are said to have worked cooperatively to create humans, and until Dorman's ascension he was considered a patron God of all humanity. In the Gods War it was Alohim and Mat'raktha's argument over who should have dominion over Kings and Nations that quickly descended into argument and war. The clergy of Alohim acknowledge this, claiming the dominion of rulership was granted to Alohim at his creation. The sun is considered to be a manifestation of Alohim's power.
documents.level1: **Light of Dawn.** You know the light cantrip and can cast it at will.
documents.level10: **Cleansing Light of Alohim.** You can cast the daylight spell as a 3rd level spell 1/day without using a spellslot.

documents.name: Amathera
documents.holysymbol: A sheaf of grain over a kite shield
documents.domains: Safety, Family, Community, Peace, and Protection
documents.worshippers:
The poor, the weak, and those in need of protection from greater foes all pray to Amathera. The nation of Zelfir worships Amathera exclusively, as she aided them in their liberation from the Sorceron now imprisoned in the Sorcerer's Prison.

The clergy of Amathera receive little to no recognition (at least outside of Zelfir) and live as humbly as those they administer to, usually having cells within the poor houses they operate. They must be blessed with robust health by Amathera for they often work in the dirtiest and most dangerous areas, yet they rarely suffer from disease or attack. Indeed, only the most wretchedly depraved would attack a cleric of Amathera while he was undertaking his duty, for all are welcome to the protection of the Goddess.
documents.appearance: Amathera appears as a tall, slender, well muscled woman with dark hair and brown eyes.  Typically dressed in a simple white dress or robe and carrying a large shield. She wears a crown of olive leaves
tenets: All people of means should give of what they have to the poor.
Knowledge is a safeguard against the evils of war. Learning is the pathway to peace.
Love for your neighbor is the paramount good
I must never force another to my will. Rather I must sit with my enemies and teach them, that they might be edified and learn a better way.
documents.holiday: Amatherin 30, the Festival of the Lowly. Each year on the shortest day of the year Amathera's priests hold the feast of the lowly where the poorest in the community are honored guests and all must bring offerings of their best to grace them.
documents.parents: 3rd generation, born of Alohim and Nera
documents.lore: Amathera is mentioned little in the ancient texts, besides that she is the daughter of Alohim and Nera. The greatest single work she is known for is the freeing of the Hisru peoples from their Sorceron master. She is not prone to great works, grand proclomations, or righteous war. Rather she slowly builds up the world through acts of kindness. Rescuing refugees, feeding the poor, and building homes for the homeless.

documents.name: Annam
documents.domains: Father of Giants, God of Strength
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Area

documents.name: Area (pronounced ah-REE-ah)
documents.holysymbol: A field of grass
documents.domains: The inevitable end of times, revenge, space and distance
documents.worshippers: Area does not have worshippers, as her lore has been all but forgotten in the modern era. The Gods long ago agreed to never speak of the 3rd Mother God, worried that should she return from her imprisonment, she would end all things. Nevertheless, there have long been whispers of those touched by a mad God with no memory who speaks to them, and some few others know the truth, that beyond the known planes there is a prison for a being that not even Nera could kill.
documents.appearance: Area, when she takes a humanoid form, takes the appearance of a young girl child. Her innocent appearance belying her vengeful nature.
documents.home: Aitia, but currently confined in The Plane of ME, hidden within the Outer Realms
tenets: The world is finite, and its end approaches
The Gods themselves have sinned. Their destruction is the only correct result.
One must take from ones enemies in equal measure to what is taken from you.
documents.parents: 1st Generation
documents.lore: Area, the 3rd Mother Goddess, the Forgotten One, She who is without name. Area is the mother of 1/3 of the Gods, but is reviled by all. When the Gods War broke out, Area declared creation failed, and proposed that all of creation be destroyed so that the Mother Gods could start over. Her sisters rejected this plan, so Area attempted to disable them so she could do it herself. She struck down Gaian, putting her into a deep coma, before Nera tricked her into her current prison, her mind sealed behind walls that she cannot breach on her own. Most churches do not even acknowledge her existence except in the most hidden secret lore. It is rumored that certain arcanum crystals in the world serve as parts of the wall of her prison, and touching them can bring one into contact with a fragment of Area's mind. This fragment, known as ME because it cannot remember it's name, nor remember the concept of having one (I am ME, it often says when asked), blindly grasps at minds to attempt to find servants willing to free it, releasing some portion of Area's power back into the world. Some say it succeeded once, only to have its Avatar destroyed by Nera herself with the aid of a group of adventurers.

documents.name: Arengesus
documents.holysymbol: A pair of dice
documents.domains: God of Randomness and pure Chaos
documents.worshippers:
Gamblers and the desperate

He has no clergy as he is not largely worshipped, which is not to say that he couldn't, just that he doesn't.
documents.appearance: Arengesus appearance is always random when he appears to his followers.  One day he could appear as a small child, and the next day as a talking sandwich.  His true form, if one exists, is known only to his most loyal followers.
tenets: Your life is more fulfilling and entertaining when you throw off the boundaries of the normal schema of the world and behave in a manner that is random and unpredictable.
documents.parents: Migrated from another multiverse, taking over the domain of the long deceased Tychaios, who was 3rd generation, born of Area and Fanome.

documents.name: Asmodeus
documents.holysymbol: A pentagram
documents.domains: Lord of Devils, God of Pacts
documents.appearance: Asmodeus appears to mortals as a thin, extremely tall, charismatic red-skinned humanoid with horns and glowing red eyes. However, it is believed that this appearance is a front. His true form is unknown.
documents.parents: 3rd generation, born of Mat'raktha and Nera

documents.name: Ba'al
documents.holysymbol: A skull surrounded by drops of blood
documents.domains: Lord of Demons, God of Destruction, Rape, Pillage, and Fear
documents.worshippers:
Ba'al is not so much worshipped as feared. The demons fear his wrath. If the lesser Demon Lords felt they could challenge him and win, they probably would do so, but it speaks to Ba'al's power that until now none have. Mortals who pay homage to Ba'al usually are fools who think they can outsmart him as part of a deal. Few live through the experience, fewer still come out ahead.

The clergy of Ba'al tend to be hedonists who believe Ba'als promise of eternal domination of their peers.
documents.appearance: Ba'al typically appears similar to the Balor's, but larger, as a massive 20 ft tall humanoid creature with red skin, wings, and horns. The fires of the abyss shine through his eyes and mouth, and the world morphs around him.
tenets: Loyalty is for the weak
The only true way to control others is through fear.
The multiverse by rights should belong to Ba'al as part of the abyss, subject to his will.
documents.parents: 3rd generation, born of Nera and Zhuul

documents.name: Bahamut
documents.holysymbol: A platinum dragon on a blue background
documents.domains: Lord of Metallic Dragons, God of Righteous Might
documents.worshippers:
Bahamut is worshiped by the people of Dera'Dragorim for his rescue of their people as well as those who admire the strength, power, and goodness of metallic dragons, as well as good dragons themselves.

The priests of Bahamut are usually second or third sons of noble houses (at least those that are not dragons themselves). Their inheritance, such as it is, is usually donated to the church. In return they serve the dragons that serve as the protectors of Dera'Dragorim, and communicate to them the needs of the people.
documents.appearance: Bahamut appears as a colossal dragon with scales of silver, gold, copper and bronze that reflect the light in prismatic colors.
tenets: Show courage in the face of evil and protect the weak whenever possible.
documents.parents: 3rd generation, born of Indra and Nera
documents.lore: In Dera'Dragorim, the priests of Bahamut are responsible for watching over the clutches of dragon eggs until they hatch. When the first crack appears a celebration begins, and the mother is magically summoned so that imprinting can occur.

documents.name: Bragi
documents.domains: God of Poetry and Speech
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Dorun and Nera

documents.name: Chronos
documents.domains: God of Time
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Tock and Gaian

documents.name: Chthonis
documents.domains: God of the Deep Stone, Magma, and Earthquakes
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Dorun and Gaian

documents.name: Cora
documents.holysymbol: A Flaming Banner
documents.domains: Goddess of Righteous War, Lost Causes, and Heroes
documents.worshippers:
Cora is entreated by those who fear their cause is lost, but choose to persist regardless; soldiers of a Good persuasion; and a large part of the populations of Seran, Terron, and Shendarel, as Cora protected and aided them during the Nerim Cataclysm.

The Clergy of Cora travel the land seeking causes to aid for every cause turned from lost to success is an honor to their God. Others are embedded in military units, where they serve as clerical support, healers, and battle mages.
documents.appearance: Cora appears as a valkyrie-like blue eyed woman in shining full plate and wielding a great sword, with shoulder length hair typically tied back.
tenets: Trying to do the right thing is what matters, not whether others approve of it or how likely you are to succeed.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Alohim and Area
documents.lore: Cora is the defender of lost causes, the warrior of justice, the crusader. She honors those who seek to do right regardless of law or chance of success.

documents.name: Dorman
documents.holysymbol: A white sword on a red background
documents.domains: God of Might and Rule by Strength
documents.worshippers:
The worshipers of Dorman are typically those who wish to overcome their enemies, whether in noble battle or through manipulation of the law. Dorman is highly revered among the noble houses of Dormania, where his very existence proves to them their divine right to rule, as well as among generals and officers in various armies around the world.

The clergy of Dorman are often retired military officers and usually command a large force of citizen militia. They often ride out to war with the armies not as chaplains but as fellow warriors, committing themselves to where the battle is hottest to bring victory and conquest for their king and God.
documents.appearance: Dorman appears as an older muscular man in armor, with a sword at his waist and a shield strapped to his back or arm.  His hair is dark with streaks of gray, and his eyes are blue.  He is built wide rather than tall, with a thick bull-like neck.
tenets: The victor writes the law, and the law decides the victor.
Justice is the acquisition of their due by the strong
The lower classes should be looked after, for the strength of the ruler is the sum of the strength of the ruled.
documents.parents: Ascended Mortal, who took the place of Woden. Woden was 3rd Generation, born of Tock and Area.

documents.name: Dorun
documents.holysymbol: A black pick and hammer crossed over a silver background
documents.domains: God of Earth, Stone, and Music
documents.worshippers:
There is not a dwarf in the world who does not feel the call of the church of Dorun, whether they actively worship him or not, deep places resonate in their bones and the deep places resonate with the sound of His voice. Occasionally gnomes from Stagenheim who live deep within their caves will also take up the worship of Dorun, but for them it does not resonate quite so strongly.

The clergy of Dorun are often great singers or composers. They often dedicate new holds and caverns with their first songs personally. They also enforce the caste system of dwarven society, refusing to dedicate caverns that are to be the home of any who have lived on the surface, for to be separated from the song of Dorun is to be separated from God.
documents.allowedalignments: Neutral Good, Lawful Neutral, Neutral, Chaotic Neutral, Neutral Evil
documents.appearance: Dorun appears as a middle-aged but still powerful looking dwarf, bald but with a long graying red braided beard.  He wears robes of black and gold studded with gemstones.
tenets: The song of Dorun should never be left to die
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Gaian
documents.lore: Dorun takes great pleasure in song, especially those that resonate throughout his caverns and caves. Even bar songs in the depths of the Dwarven holds contain complicated harmony and counterpoint that is only enhanced when heard from 20 or 30 miles away as it echoes through chamber after chamber. Hymns are even more complicated. He further encourages his followers to delve deeply into the earth in search of rare metals and new places to call home. Magic runes were a gift of Dorun to dwarven bards and wizards who were great composers. The deep resonant tones of the dwarven voice are most suited to His worship, but higher tones and instruments are not turned away.

documents.name: Fa'atasi
documents.holysymbol: A disc half white and half black, similar to Nera's but inverted, with the black on top.
documents.domains: Madness, the Far Realm
documents.worshippers: Fa'atasi has no dedicated worshipers, any creature that is afflicted with a madness of some kind is his worshiper but they are unaware that he is speaking to them. When they hear whispers or see something it is Fa`atasi. This is how he gets power.
documents.weapon: The Mind Spike, a morning star mace with a brain on the end with a bunch of spikes coming out of it.
documents.appearance: He appears as whatever the being thinks about while under the madness, he has no physical form that anyone knows about.
tenets: The universe is not truly explainable by logic, mortals attempts to make sense of the universe are their pointless attempts at preventing their inevitable insanity.
documents.parents: 3rd generation, born of Zhuul and Area
documents.lore: He likes to spread madness to anything he can, in any realm that he can. He isn't out to destroy any worlds or to take over but just to spread madness. Creatures of the Far Realm are more akin to playthings for him. He will inflict madness upon anything to gain power and try to spread to all realms.

documents.name: Fanome
documents.holysymbol: A coin with a grinning gnomish face.
documents.domains: God of Tricksters and Illusions, patron of Gnomes
documents.worshippers:
Gnomes, practical jokers, illusionists

Fanome is widely worshipped among the Imperial Gnomes, and has a sizable following among the Stagen Gnomes as well.  Outside of the gnomes, his adherents are few and far between.
documents.appearance: Fanome's appearance varies greatly, although he typically favors that of a gnomish child.
tenets: Guile and wit are the greatest of virtues
A trick in good fun is good for all.
documents.parents: 2nd generation, born of Area
documents.lore: Fanome teaches that guile and wit are the greatest of virtues.  Tales tell of the tricks he plays on his fellow gods, things such as stealing from Bahamut's hoard, and then tricking Tiamat into thinking she had perpetrated the theft, or tricking Molton into giving mortals the power to make fire without entreating him.

documents.name: Frosti
documents.domains: God of Ice, Snow, and Winter
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Trimala and Area

documents.name: Funkus
documents.domains: God of Dance/Celebration
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Annam and Gaian

documents.name: Gaian
documents.holysymbol: An oak tree on a white background
documents.domains: Goddess of Nature and Creation
documents.worshippers:
Fey, elves, druids, barbarians, and other beings closely tied to nature worship Gaian.

Gaian has few priests, rather the druids serve as her clergy, administering to and protecting nature itself rather than men.
documents.appearance: Gaian appears as an elf, but with skin like the bark of a tree with leaves and shoots sprouting from all over her body, such that she is clothed in vines.  Her eyes are black as the night sky.
documents.parents: 1st Generation
documents.lore: Gaian teaches balance with nature, and that sentient races should be part of nature rather than dominating it. The worship of the goddess of nature lends itself to a hunter gathering life more than a sedentary or agrarian lifestyle. Gaian's worshiper's festivals fall on the solstices and equinoxes to signify the change of seasons.

documents.name: Ganarea
documents.domains: God of Pestilance and Disease
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Sylvan and Area

documents.name: Hije
documents.domains: Goddess of Shadow, Thieves, Master of the Shadowfell
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Zhuul and Gaian

documents.name: Indra
documents.domains: Goddess of Greed and Individuality, Mother of Dragons
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Nera

documents.name: Interitus
documents.domains: God of Decay, Fungus, and Soil
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Vrasja and Gaian

documents.name: Kamin
documents.domains: God of Fire in Service of Man, the Hearth, and Cooking
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Molton and Area

documents.name: Labious
documents.domains: Goddess of Fertility, Love, Luck, and animal husbandry
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Sylvan and Nera

documents.name: Leviathan
documents.domains: Lord of the Great Sea Creatures (dragon turtles, whales, aboleths, etc)
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Indra and Gaian

documents.name: Magus
documents.domains: God of Magic
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Tock and Gaian

documents.name: Malik
documents.holysymbol: 8 arrows pointing outward from a single source
documents.domains: God of Destruction and Wars of Pillage
documents.worshippers:
Malik is worshiped by those who seek chaos and anything that causes it, as well as those with few morals and a penchant for battle. He has many worshipers among the orcs and hobgoblins, and there is an underground cult of Malik among the trollkin as well.

Malik's clergy rarely establish temples, rather they go out seeking to create chaos, often joining with armies. Military units that worship Malik tend to be disorganized irregulars that strike out at their enemies in unpredictable ways, and are granted powerful blessings and great strength in return.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Mat'raktha and Area

documents.name: Maris
documents.holysymbol: A ship at full sail
documents.domains: God of Travel, Trade, and Fair Deals
documents.worshippers:
Merchants of all kinds worship Maris. Wherever you find coin exchanging hands there you will find his worshipers. He is also often worshiped by those undertaking long journeys or seeking knowledge of the future.

Maris clergy typically possess a great deal of wealth, obtained through their own speculations, and the donations they require of their wealthy followers. They are often merchants in their own right as well as priests, trading in bulk goods, land, or other ventures that don't require a monopoly on their time.
documents.appearance: Maris appears as a blind man with dark hair and a silken blindfold over his eyes.  He typically dresses in purple robes with gold scroll-work down the front and back.  He carries a golden scale around his neck and a silver rod with a crystal ball on top.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Trimala and Nera
documents.lore: Maris favors fair trade of all kinds, although he certainly doesn't frown on his followers getting better than fair prices. He is the great speculator God, and his worshipers will often come to him to find how prices will change over time. Maris festivals coincide with the opening and closing of the summer markets.

documents.name: Mat'raktha
documents.holysymbol: A downward pointing spike
documents.domains: God of Darkness and Tyranny. Patron of Orcs and Goblinoids
documents.worshippers:
Mat'raktha is worshipped by evil people throughout the world, if in secret in most places.  He is the patron of Orcs and the orcish tribes of Malinval and Olda mostly worship him.

Where his worship is allowed Mat'raktha's clerics extract tribute from his worshippers in return for blessings against their enemies.  Internal politicking among the clergy is common and those who rise high are either highly skilled, or quickly dead.
documents.appearance: Mat'raktha appears as an orc with very light olive green skin.  He has somewhat rough dark blonde hair precisely styled in neat dreads pulled back with a leather thong.  He is large and very muscled with sharp features and dark brown almost black eyes.  He is extremely well dressed, not necessarily expensive clothing but well-made, everything perfectly clean and neat.  Shoes and armor are always polished and there is never anything like worn cuffs or hanging threads. His Tusks are also always well-filed and polished.
tenets: One must dominate their enemies through force.
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Nera
documents.lore: His pride and hatred are what started the god War, and those who worship him are typically of the belief that the terms of the peace imposed at the end of the god War stripped Mat'raktha of what was rightfully his, domination over all the other god as King.

documents.name: Moira
documents.domains: Goddess of Fate
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Annam and Nera

documents.name: Molton
documents.holysymbol: flames
documents.domains: God of Fire, Fertility, and Lust
documents.worshippers:
Molton has few worshippers, he offers little to mortal men. Those related to the plane of fire, such as fire mephlings, mephits, elementals, and genasi. He also finds some devotees among sorcerers and wizards who admire the power of fire.

Molton's temples tend to be in remote locations near volcanoes and other places where the power of fire is apparent. For example, the elves have built a shrine to Molton at the top of the Glass Cliff. His priests keep great fires burning in the temples at all times, where clothing is shed in the warmth of the blaze and inhibitions lowered. Women who have had trouble conceiving often come to the temples of Molton to receive his blessing. Each year at midsummer the priests of Molton hold the rite of purification, in which the devout walk through fire. After doing so evil deeds are considered washed away.
documents.appearance: Molton appears as a muscular and beautiful red haired man clothed completely in flames with bright blue eyes like blue fire.
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Gaian

documents.name: Mystikinae
documents.domains: God of Secrets, Lies, and Forbidden Knowledge
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Fanome and Gaian

documents.name: Nera
documents.holysymbol: A disc half white and half black
documents.domains: Goddess of Life, Birth, and Death
documents.worshippers: Nera's worshippers are rare and hunted in most countries in the modern era, as the common belief is that she is the God of Necromancers. She is worshipped as the one true great God in the country of Arad. Within Arad, her church acts as both ruler and church.
documents.appearance: The mother of the gods (or so she claims) has a very curvy healthy figure.  Pale, glowing skin, blue-black long wavy hair, dresses in long white flowing clothing with bare feet.  She has a round face with a wide generous mouth large silver-grey eyes with a straight nose.
tenets: All must eventually face the death of their mortal bodies. It is best to accept death with grace.
Bodies are but houses for the soul, once the soul has departed the body should be used to help the living.
documents.parents: 1st Generation

documents.name: Odio
documents.domains: God of Hatred
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Vrasja and Area

documents.name: Ptoma
documents.domains: God of Undeath and the Undead
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Vrasja and Nera

documents.name: Sara
documents.holysymbol: a cornucopia
documents.domains: Goddess of Growth and Harvest
documents.worshippers:
farmers and agrarian communities

Clergy of Sara are typically humble men and women who live in small communities or wander from community to community spreading both the worship of Sara and planting fruit trees or other producing plants along the way from which everyone can benefit. Their dress is typically crude, often simple linen, cotton, or flaxen robes, but they never go hungry.
documents.appearance: Sara appears as a halfling with short golden brown curly hair.  She wears simple brown dresses and garb with green embroidered runes a straw hat and a basket on her arm filled with the fruits of the harvest.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Alohim and Gaian
documents.lore: Any person who nurtures a plants growth is considered to be worshiping Sara. In the spring and in the fall the priests of Sara perform rituals to garner Sara's blessings on the planting and harvest in which the entire community usually participates. These rituals tend to be holidays for the entire community. Sara's blessings are usually subtle, such as more grain in the granary than was growing in the field, or plants that produce past the frost or more fruit than is typical. She rewards her most devout with an unusual knowledge of plants and how to achieve the best harvest possible.

documents.name: Sedna
documents.domains: Goddess of Fish and Sea Creatures
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Trimala and Gaian

documents.name: Serangga
documents.holysymbol: A giant snake with insect legs in the shape of an "S" with 2 mandibles coming out the side of the mouth.
documents.domains: Goddess of Insects, Snakes, and Crawling Things
documents.worshippers: Ettercaps, Yuan-Ti
documents.appearance: Serangga appears as a 200 ft long snake black snake body with spider/centipede legs all down the torso. She has 4 Red eyes stacked on top of each other. When it opens its mouth 2 large barbed mandibles come out instead of teeth along with a forked tongue. The mandibles are venomous. She spends most of its time under the dirt.
tenets: The fittest survive
It is the kill that matters
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Dorun and Area
documents.lore: Serangga burrows under the ground and stays hidden most of the time, but when she is hungry she bursts from the ground to ambush her prey. The force of her sudden burst from the earth can cause earthquakes for miles around. Serangga is the embodiement of the principal Survial of the Fittest. She has no emotions as mortals typically consider them, considering only her own survival in her calculations.

documents.name: Sylvan
documents.holysymbol: a white cloud
documents.domains: God of Air, Wind, and Animals. Patron of Elves and Fey
documents.worshippers:
elves, rangers, and woodsmen.

Clergy of Sylvan are well regarded in elven society, although they are rare elsewhere.  Their ceremonial dress is robes made of pure spider silk that cling to the skin, and crowns of laurels or leaves.  Their work typically involves the nurturing of the great trees, huge and ancient, in whose branches many elven settlements are built.  A work they take very seriously. Sects outside of elven society usually focus on one of her other aspects, preaching of the fickle nature of existence and the need to help others while we can.
documents.appearance: Sylvan appears as a tall elf, silver haired and blue eyed.  Sylvan does not have a set gender, and often appears as a man, a woman, or even a hermaphrodite.
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Gaian
documents.lore:
Sylvan is worshipped in the planting of trees, frolicking in the wind, and the caring of animals.  Sylvan differs from Gaian, however, in that its dogma focuses on the preservation of nature for the use of mortals and creatures, rather than as a foil to them.

Sylvan is also the God of exploration, discovery, granting her favor to those who explore distant shores and unseen wonders.  Some sects also play on her more chaotic nature, recognizing that deceit and trickery are sometimes necessary for the greater good.

documents.name: Tiamat
documents.holysymbol: 5 dragon claws arranged into a five pointed star. Each in a color of one of the types of chromatic dragons.
documents.domains: Lord of Chromatic Dragons, God of Plots
documents.worshippers:
Tiamat is worshiped by evil dragons and those that serve and admire them.

Tiamat has few clerics, but those she has seek to extend the power of evil dragons.
documents.appearance: Tiamat is a 5-headed dragon with one head each of a red dragon, black dragon, blue dragon, white dragon, and green dragon.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Indra and Area
documents.lore: As the God of Evil Dragons Tiamat stands in opposition to Bahamut in all things. She concerns herself with spreading evil through conquest, destruction, and plots. She seeks to extend the powers of evil dragons throughout the land.

documents.name: Tock
documents.holysymbol: Two interlocking gears
documents.domains: God of Absolute Order, Writing, and Mechanical Things
documents.worshippers:
Tock is worshiped by craftsman and inventors, particularly among the gnomes of Stagenheim, whom he has blessed with great knowledge and skill with crafts.

The clergy of Tock are usually great craftsman in their own right, and his temple provides a bounty for particularly interesting ideas so that their inventors can build and test them.
documents.appearance: Tock has the appearance of a living machine in the shape of a halfling or gnome.  He is studded with exposed gears and wires, and wears only a monacle.  He is typically seen carrying one or more thick tomes and is often writing furiously in one or more of them.
tenets: one should enrich oneself by taking advantage of the laws and forces of the universe to create new and interesting things.
Books are holy things, and should never be destroyed.
One should write a detailed record of all they learn for future generations
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Nera
documents.lore: Tock is the father of the Modrons, small mechanical beings that build things, as well as the Inevitables, a group of incredibly powerful constructs that enforce the order of the universe.

documents.name: Trimala
documents.holysymbol: A Waterfall cascading over a cliff
documents.domains: Goddess of Sea and Storm
documents.worshippers:
Those who live off of the sea or rivers tend to pay tribute to Trimala, as well as lizardmen and other amphibious, reptilian, and fish creatures.

Trimala's clergy intercede with her to seek her mercy on behalf of ship captains and crewmen before making journeys by sea, and on behalf of those who live near coasts to preserve them from the forces of the ocean. Inland they are often called upon in times of drought to pray for rain.
documents.appearance: Trimala appears in the shape of a woman, but entirely composed of water.  She can appear in any size, and often has sea creatures swimming around inside her form.
tenets: Only Trimala has the right to take a life upon the seas.
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Gaian
documents.lore: Trimala is the goddess of water in all forms and places, from the icy glaciers to the oceans and rivers. She is also the patron goddess of creatures that depend on water, and the Lady of the Moons and Tides. She teaches respect for the sea and its creatures and that all are subject to forces greater than oneself.

documents.name: Trolka
documents.holysymbol: A white haired green skinned grinning troll's face
documents.domains: God of Hunger, Gluttony, and Excess. Patron of Trolls and Hill Giants
documents.worshippers: Trolka the ever hungry is the God of giants and trolls, and almost all trolls and most giants worship them.
documents.appearance: Trolka appears as a massive and incredibly ugly troll with tusks and claws made of steel.  His skin is a ruddy-green color.
tenets: You must multiply and consume the world.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Annam and Area

documents.name: Vrasja
documents.domains: God of Assassins, Murder, and Blood
documents.parents: 2nd Generation, born of Area

documents.name: Vulcan
documents.holysymbol: A Smith's hammer made entirely out of lava
documents.domains: God of Volcanos, Fiery Destruction, and Smithing
documents.worshippers: Blacksmith's, Salamanders, and some dwarves
documents.weapon: a warhammer. His personal weapon is a massive warhammer named Lava Forger.
documents.appearance: 10 ft tall, tan skinned, shaved head with a beard of flowing lava.Wears a blacksmith apron with no undershirt. and black leather pants. His eyes are the red/orange of lava, just the iris.He has dwarvish features.
tenets: Keep the forge hot, and your soul hotter.
When smithing, be perfect. When in battle, rain down fiery destruction.
documents.parents: 3rd Generation, born of Molton and Gaian
documents.lore: The weapons and armor the Vulcan makes, are perfection. The gods themselves rarely get his weapons as he deems them to powerful. No mortal has ever had a weapon of his make. He has occasionally taught blacksmiths that will venture into the Plane of Fire.

documents.name: Zhuul
documents.holysymbol: A black skull and crossbones
documents.domains: God of the Void
documents.worshippers:
Zhuul, Lord of Decay, is worshipped by those whose hearts are twisted by hatred or jealousy.  He offers them revenge for perceived wrongs, binding the souls of his worshippers eternally to his service.  To others he offers forbidden or hidden knowledge.  He is a patron to evil wizards and pirates.

Zhuul's clergy come from every race and country, attaching themselves to evil aligned organizations or disguising themselves as clergy of other Gods or by holding other jobs or professions.
documents.appearance: Zhuul appears to others generally as an area of darkness through which no light can pass.
tenets: All of creation will inevitably end, and at that point only Zhuul and his chosen will remain.
documents.parents: 2nd generation, born of Area
